docTitle.name: shortTitle
docTitle.content: Telecommunications (Method for Determining Spectrum Utilization Fee) (Administratively Assigned Spectrum in the 1800 MHz Band) Regulation

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.def: existing assignee (現有受配人) means a person who has been assigned, for a period ending on 29 September 2021, the use of any spectrum that falls within the following frequency bands—(a)1710.5–1780.1 MHz and 1805.5–1875.1 MHz set out in Part 2 of the Schedule to the Telecommunications (Designation of Frequency Bands subject to Payment of Spectrum Utilization Fee) Order (Cap. 106 sub. leg. Y);(b)1780.1–1784.9 MHz and 1875.1–1879.9 MHz set out in Part 2A of that Schedule;
specified period (指明期間) means a period of 15 years beginning on 30 September 2021 and ending on 29 September 2036;
specified spectrum (指明頻譜) means any spectrum that falls within the frequency bands set out in the Schedule.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Authority makes an offer to assign to an existing assignee any specified spectrum for use by that assignee for the specified period; and

subsection.leadIn: The spectrum utilization fee payable by an existing assignee for every 1 kHz of any specified spectrum assigned for the specified period is the higher of the following—

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the auction price referred to in subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: The auction price is the average spectrum utilization fee for every 1 kHz of the aggregate of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: all spectrum utilization fees obtained for the spectrum auctioned under section 3(1AAE) of the Telecommunications (Determining Spectrum Utilization Fees by Auction) Regulation (Cap. 106 sub. leg. AC);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if applicable—all spectrum utilization fees obtained for the spectrum auctioned under section 3(1AAF) of that Regulation.

subsection.content: However, if the spectrum utilization fee determined under subsection (1) is higher than $70,000 for every 1 kHz, the spectrum utilization fee payable by the existing assignee for every 1 kHz of the spectrum assigned is $70,000.
This section is subject to section 5.

subsection.leadIn: The spectrum utilization fee payable under this Regulation must be paid—

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: annually in 15 instalments in accordance with subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: For subsection (1)(b), the spectrum utilization fee for each instalment is as follows—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the first instalment—an amount equal to the lump sum referred to in subsection (1)(a) divided by 15;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for each subsequent instalment—an amount equal to the spectrum utilization fee payable in the immediately preceding instalment increased by 2.5%.

subsection.content: The spectrum utilization fee is payable at the time and in the way required by the Authority.
